play.title: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra

scene.scenelocation: Alexandria. A room in Cleopatra’s palace.
scene.line: Look where they come!
Take but good note, and you shall see in him
The triple pillar of the world transform’d
Into a strumpet’s fool. Behold and see.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: If it be love indeed, tell me how much.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: There’s beggary in the love that can be reckon’d.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: I’ll set a bourn how far to be belov’d.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Then must thou needs find out new heaven, new earth.

speech.speaker: 1. ROM. MESS.
speech.line: News, my good lord, from Rome.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Grates me, the sum.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Nay, hear them, Antony.
Fulvia perchance is angry; or who knows
If the scarce-bearded Caesar have not sent
His pow’rful mandate to you: “Do this, or this;
Take in that kingdom, and enfranchise that;
Perform’t, or else we damn thee.”

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: How, my love?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Perchance? Nay, and most like.
You must not stay here longer, your dismission
Is come from Caesar, therefore hear it, Antony.
Where’s Fulvia’s process?—Caesar’s, I would say—both?
Call in the messengers. As I am Egypt’s queen,
Thou blushest, Antony, and that blood of thine
Is Caesar’s homager; else so thy cheek pays shame
When shrill-tongu’d Fulvia scolds. The messengers!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Let Rome in Tiber melt, and the wide arch
Of the rang’d empire fall! Here is my space,
Kingdoms are clay; our dungy earth alike
Feeds beast as man; the nobleness of life
Is to do thus
—when such a mutual pair
And such a twain can do’t, in which I bind,
On pain of punishment, the world to weet
We stand up peerless.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Excellent falsehood!
Why did he marry Fulvia, and not love her?
I’ll seem the fool I am not. Antony
Will be himself.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: But stirr’d by Cleopatra.
Now for the love of Love, and her soft hours,
Let’s not confound the time with conference harsh;
There’s not a minute of our lives should stretch
Without some pleasure now. What sport tonight?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Hear the ambassadors.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Fie, wrangling queen!
Whom every thing becomes—to chide, to laugh,
To weep; whose every passion fully strives
To make itself (in thee) fair and admir’d!
No messenger but thine, and all alone,
Tonight we’ll wander through the streets and note
The qualities of people. Come, my queen,
Last night you did desire it.

speech.speaker: DEM.
speech.line: Is Caesar with Antonius priz’d so slight?

speech.speaker: PHI.
speech.line: Sir, sometimes when he is not Antony,
He comes too short of that great property
Which still should go with Antony.

speech.speaker: DEM.
speech.line: I am full sorry
That he approves the common liar, who
Thus speaks of him at Rome; but I will hope
Of better deeds tomorrow. Rest you happy!

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Lord Alexas, sweet Alexas, most any thing Alexas, almost most absolute Alexas, where’s the soothsayer that you prais’d so to th’ Queen? O that I knew this husband, which, you say, must change his horns with garlands!

speech.speaker: ALEX.
speech.line: Soothsayer!

speech.speaker: SOOTH.
speech.line: Your will?

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Is this the man? Is’t you, sir, that know things?

speech.speaker: SOOTH.
speech.line: In nature’s infinite book of secrecy
A little I can read.

speech.speaker: ALEX.
speech.line: Show him your hand.

speech.speaker: ENO.
ENO.
speech.line: Hush, here comes Antony.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Not he, the Queen.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Saw you my lord?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: No, lady.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Was he not here?

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: No, madam.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: He was dispos’d to mirth, but on the sudden
A Roman thought hath strook him. Enobarbus!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Madam?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Seek him, and bring him hither. Where’s Alexas?

speech.speaker: ALEX.
speech.line: Here, at your service. My lord approaches.

stagedir.dir: Enter Antony with First Messenger and Attendants.

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: Fulvia thy wife first came into the field.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Against my brother Lucius?

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: Ay;
But soon that war had end, and the time’s state
Made friends of them, jointing their force ’gainst Caesar,
Whose better issue in the war from Italy,
Upon the first encounter, drave them.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Well, what worst?

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: The nature of bad news infects the teller.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: When it concerns the fool or coward. On:
Things that are past are done with me. ’Tis thus:
Who tells me true, though in his tale lie death,
I hear him as he flatter’d.

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: Labienus
(This is stiff news) hath with his Parthian force
Extended Asia; from Euphrates
His conquering banner shook, from Syria
To Lydia and to Ionia,
Whilst—

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Antony, thou wouldst say—

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: O, my lord!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Speak to me home, mince not the general tongue;
Name Cleopatra as she is call’d in Rome.
Rail thou in Fulvia’s phrase, and taunt my faults
With such full license as both truth and malice
Have power to utter. O then we bring forth weeds
When our quick winds lie still, and our ills told us
Is as our earing. Fare thee well awhile.

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: At your noble pleasure.
What are you?

speech.speaker: 2. MESS.
speech.line: Fulvia thy wife is dead.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Where died she?

speech.speaker: 2. MESS.
speech.line: In Sicyon:
Her length of sickness, with what else more serious
Importeth thee to know, this bears.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Forbear me.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: What’s your pleasure, sir?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I must with haste from hence.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Why then we kill all our women. We see how mortal an unkindness is to them; if they suffer our departure, death’s the word.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I must be gone.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Under a compelling occasion, let women die. It were pity to cast them away for nothing, though between them and a great cause, they should be esteem’d nothing. Cleopatra, catching but the least noise of this, dies instantly; I have seen her die twenty times upon far poorer moment. I do think there is mettle in death, which commits some loving act upon her, she hath such a celerity in dying.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: She is cunning past man’s thought.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Alack, sir, no, her passions are made of nothing but the finest part of pure love. We cannot call her winds and waters sighs and tears; they are greater storms and tempests than almanacs can report. This cannot be cunning in her; if it be, she makes a show’r of rain as well as Jove.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Would I had never seen her!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: O, sir, you had then left unseen a wonderful piece of work, which not to have been blest withal would have discredited your travel.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Fulvia is dead.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Sir?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Fulvia is dead.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Fulvia?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Dead.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Why, sir, give the gods a thankful sacrifice. When it pleaseth their deities to take the wife of a man from him, it shows to man the tailors of the earth; comforting therein, that when old robes are worn out, there are members to make new. If there were no more women but Fulvia, then had you indeed a cut, and the case to be lamented. This grief is crown’d with consolation: your old smock brings forth a new petticoat, and indeed the tears live in an onion that should water this sorrow.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: The business she hath broached in the state
Cannot endure my absence.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: And the business you have broach’d here cannot be without you, especially that of Cleopatra’s, which wholly depends on your abode.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: No more light answers. Let our officers
Have notice what we purpose. I shall break
The cause of our expedience to the Queen,
And get her leave to part. For not alone
The death of Fulvia, with more urgent touches,
Do strongly speak to us; but the letters too
Of many our contriving friends in Rome
Petition us at home. Sextus Pompeius
Hath given the dare to Caesar, and commands
The empire of the sea. Our slippery people,
Whose love is never link’d to the deserver
Till his deserts are past, begin to throw
Pompey the Great and all his dignities
Upon his son, who, high in name and power,
Higher than both in blood and life, stands up
For the main soldier; whose quality, going on,
The sides o’ th’ world may danger. Much is breeding,
Which, like the courser’s hair, hath yet but life,
And not a serpent’s poison. Say our pleasure,
To such whose places under us require,
Our quick remove from hence.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I shall do’t.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Where is he?

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: I did not see him since.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: See where he is, who’s with him, what he does.
I did not send you. If you find him sad,
Say I am dancing; if in mirth, report
That I am sudden sick. Quick, and return.
But here comes Antony.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: I am sick and sullen.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I am sorry to give breathing to my purpose—

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Help me away, dear Charmian, I shall fall.
It cannot be thus long, the sides of nature
Will not sustain it.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Now, my dearest queen—

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Pray you stand farther from me.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: What’s the matter?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: I know by that same eye there’s some good news.
What, says the married woman you may go?
Would she had never given you leave to come!
Let her not say ’tis I that keep you here,
I have no power upon you; hers you are.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: The gods best know—

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: O, never was there queen
So mightily betrayed! Yet at the first
I saw the treasons planted.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Cleopatra—

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Why should I think you can be mine, and true
(Though you in swearing shake the throned gods),
Who have been false to Fulvia? Riotous madness,
To be entangled with those mouth-made vows,
Which break themselves in swearing!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Most sweet queen—

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Nay, pray you seek no color for your going,
But bid farewell, and go. When you sued staying,
Then was the time for words; no going then;
Eternity was in our lips and eyes,
Bliss in our brows’ bent; none our parts so poor
But was a race of heaven. They are so still,
Or thou, the greatest soldier of the world,
Art turn’d the greatest liar.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: How now, lady?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: I would I had thy inches, thou shouldst know
There were a heart in Egypt.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Hear me, Queen:
The strong necessity of time commands
Our services awhile; but my full heart
Remains in use with you. Our Italy
Shines o’er with civil swords; Sextus Pompeius
Makes his approaches to the port of Rome;
Equality of two domestic powers
Breed scrupulous faction; the hated, grown to strength,
Are newly grown to love; the condemn’d Pompey,
Rich in his father’s honor, creeps apace
Into the hearts of such as have not thrived
Upon the present state, whose numbers threaten,
And quietness, grown sick of rest, would purge
By any desperate change. My more particular,
And that which most with you should safe my going,
Is Fulvia’s death.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Though age from folly could not give me freedom,
It does from childishness. Can Fulvia die?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: She’s dead, my queen.
Look here, and at thy sovereign leisure read
The garboils she awak’d: at the last, best,
See when and where she died.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: O most false love!
Where be the sacred vials thou shouldst fill
With sorrowful water? Now I see, I see,
In Fulvia’s death, how mine receiv’d shall be.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Quarrel no more, but be prepar’d to know
The purposes I bear; which are, or cease,
As you shall give th’ advice. By the fire
That quickens Nilus’ slime, I go from hence
Thy soldier, servant, making peace or war
As thou affects.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Cut my lace, Charmian, come!
But let it be; I am quickly ill, and well,
So Antony loves.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: My precious queen, forbear,
And give true evidence to his love, which stands
An honorable trial.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: So Fulvia told me.
I prithee turn aside, and weep for her,
Then bid adieu to me, and say the tears
Belong to Egypt. Good now, play one scene
Of excellent dissembling, and let it look
Like perfect honor.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: You’ll heat my blood; no more.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: You can do better yet; but this is meetly.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Now, by my sword—

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: And target.—Still he mends.
But this is not the best. Look, prithee, Charmian,
How this Herculean Roman does become
The carriage of his chafe.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I’ll leave you, lady.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Courteous lord, one word:
Sir, you and I must part, but that’s not it;
Sir, you and I have lov’d, but there’s not it;
That you know well. Something it is I would—
O, my oblivion is a very Antony,
And I am all forgotten.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: But that your royalty
Holds idleness your subject, I should take you
For idleness itself.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: ’Tis sweating labor
To bear such idleness so near the heart
As Cleopatra this. But, sir, forgive me,
Since my becomings kill me when they do not
Eye well to you. Your honor calls you hence,
Therefore be deaf to my unpitied folly,
And all the gods go with you! Upon your sword
Sit laurel victory, and smooth success
Be strew’d before your feet!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Let us go. Come;
Our separation so abides and flies,
That thou residing here, goes yet with me;
And I hence fleeting, here remain with thee.
Away!

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: You may see, Lepidus, and henceforth know,
It is not Caesar’s natural vice to hate
Our great competitor. From Alexandria
This is the news: he fishes, drinks, and wastes
The lamps of night in revel; is not more manlike
Than Cleopatra; nor the queen of Ptolomy
More womanly than he; hardly gave audience, or
Vouchsaf’d to think he had partners. You shall find there
A man who is th’ abstract of all faults
That all men follow.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: I must not think there are
Evils enow to darken all his goodness:
His faults, in him, seem as the spots of heaven,
More fiery by night’s blackness; hereditary,
Rather than purchas’d; what he cannot change,
Than what he chooses.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: You are too indulgent. Let’s grant it is not
Amiss to tumble on the bed of Ptolomy,
To give a kingdom for a mirth, to sit
And keep the turn of tippling with a slave,
To reel the streets at noon, and stand the buffet
With knaves that smells of sweat: say this becomes him
(As his composure must be rare indeed
Whom these things cannot blemish), yet must Antony
No way excuse his foils, when we do bear
So great weight in his lightness. If he fill’d
His vacancy with his voluptuousness,
Full surfeits and the dryness of his bones
Call on him for’t. But to confound such time
That drums him from his sport and speaks as loud
As his own state and ours, ’tis to be chid—
As we rate boys who, being mature in knowledge,
Pawn their experience to their present pleasure,
And so rebel to judgment.

speech.speaker: 2. CAES. MESS.
speech.line: Caesar, I bring thee word
Menecrates and Menas, famous pirates,
Makes the sea serve them, which they ear and wound
With keels of every kind. Many hot inroads
They make in Italy; the borders maritime
Lack blood to think on’t, and flush youth revolt.
No vessel can peep forth, but ’tis as soon
Taken as seen; for Pompey’s name strikes more
Than could his war resisted.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Antony,
Leave thy lascivious wassails. When thou once
Was beaten from Modena, where thou slew’st
Hirtius and Pansa, consuls, at thy heel
Did famine follow, whom thou fought’st against
(Though daintily brought up) with patience more
Than savages could suffer. Thou didst drink
The stale of horses and the gilded puddle
Which beasts would cough at; thy palate then did deign
The roughest berry on the rudest hedge;
Yea, like the stag, when snow the pasture sheets,
The barks of trees thou brows’d. On the Alps
It is reported thou didst eat strange flesh,
Which some did die to look on; and all this
(It wounds thine honor that I speak it now)
Was borne so like a soldier, that thy cheek
So much as lank’d not.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: ’Tis pity of him.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Let his shames quickly
Drive him to Rome. ’Tis time we twain
Did show ourselves i’ th’ field, and to that end
Assemble we immediate council. Pompey
Thrives in our idleness.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Tomorrow, Caesar,
I shall be furnish’d to inform you rightly
Both what by sea and land I can be able
To front this present time.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Till which encounter,
It is my business too. Farewell.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Farewell, my lord. What you shall know mean time
Of stirs abroad, I shall beseech you, sir,
To let me be partaker.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Doubt not, sir,
I knew it for my bond.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Charmian!

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Madam?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Ha, ha!
Give me to drink mandragora.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Why, madam?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: That I might sleep out this great gap of time
My Antony is away.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: You think of him too much.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: O, ’tis treason!

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Madam, I trust not so.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Thou, eunuch Mardian!

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: What’s your Highness’ pleasure?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Not now to hear thee sing. I take no pleasure
In aught an eunuch has. ’Tis well for thee,
That being unseminar’d, thy freer thoughts
May not fly forth of Egypt. Hast thou affections?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Yes, gracious madam.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Indeed?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Not in deed, madam, for I can do nothing
But what indeed is honest to be done;
Yet have I fierce affections, and think
What Venus did with Mars.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: O Charmian!
Where think’st thou he is now? Stands he, or sits he?
Or does he walk? Or is he on his horse?
O happy horse, to bear the weight of Antony!
Do bravely, horse, for wot’st thou whom thou mov’st?
The demi-Atlas of this earth, the arm
And burgonet of men. He’s speaking now,
Or murmuring, “Where’s my serpent of old Nile?”
(For so he calls me). Now I feed myself
With most delicious poison. Think on me,
That am with Phoebus’ amorous pinches black,
And wrinkled deep in time? Broad-fronted Caesar,
When thou wast here above the ground, I was
A morsel for a monarch; and great Pompey
Would stand and make his eyes grow in my brow;
There would he anchor his aspect, and die
With looking on his life.

scene.scenelocation: Messina. Pompey’s house.

stagedir.dir: Enter Pompey, Menecrates, and Menas, in warlike manner.

scene.line: How now, Varrius?

speech.speaker: VAR.
speech.line: This is most certain that I shall deliver:
Mark Antony is every hour in Rome
Expected. Since he went from Egypt, ’tis
A space for farther travel.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I could have given less matter
A better ear. Menas, I did not think
This amorous surfeiter would have donn’d his helm
For such a petty war. His soldiership
Is twice the other twain; but let us rear
The higher our opinion, that our stirring
Can from the lap of Egypt’s widow pluck
The ne’er-lust-wearied Antony.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: I cannot hope
Caesar and Antony shall well greet together:
His wife that’s dead did trespasses to Caesar;
His brother warr’d upon him, although I think
Not mov’d by Antony.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I know not, Menas,
How lesser enmities may give way to greater.
Were’t not that we stand up against them all,
’Twere pregnant they should square between themselves,
For they have entertained cause enough
To draw their swords; but how the fear of us
May cement their divisions, and bind up
The petty difference, we yet not know.
Be’t as our gods will have’t! It only stands
Our lives upon to use our strongest hands.
Come, Menas.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Good Enobarbus, ’tis a worthy deed,
And shall become you well, to entreat your captain
To soft and gentle speech.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I shall entreat him
To answer like himself. If Caesar move him,
Let Antony look over Caesar’s head
And speak as loud as Mars. By Jupiter,
Were I the wearer of Antonio’s beard,
I would not shave’t today.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: ’Tis not a time
For private stomaching.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Every time
Serves for the matter that is then born in’t.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: But small to greater matters must give way.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Not if the small come first.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Your speech is passion;
But pray you stir no embers up. Here comes
The noble Antony.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: If we compose well here, to Parthia.
Hark, Ventidius.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: I do not know,
Maecenas; ask Agrippa.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Noble friends,
That which combin’d us was most great, and let not
A leaner action rend us. What’s amiss,
May it be gently heard. When we debate
Our trivial difference loud, we do commit
Murder in healing wounds. Then, noble partners,
The rather for I earnestly beseech,
Touch you the sourest points with sweetest terms,
Nor curstness grow to th’ matter.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: ’Tis spoken well.
Were we before our armies, and to fight,
I should do thus.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Welcome to Rome.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Thank you.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Sit.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Sit, sir.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Nay then.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I learn you take things ill which are not so—
Or being, concern you not.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: I must be laugh’d at
If, or for nothing or a little, I
Should say myself offended, and with you
Chiefly i’ th’ world; more laugh’d at, that I should
Once name you derogately, when to sound your name
It not concern’d me.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: My being in Egypt, Caesar,
What was’t to you?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: No more than my residing here at Rome
Might be to you in Egypt; yet if you there
Did practice on my state, your being in Egypt
Might be my question.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: How intend you, practic’d?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: You may be pleas’d to catch at mine intent
By what did here befall me. Your wife and brother
Made wars upon me, and their contestation
Was theme for you—you were the word of war.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: You do mistake your business, my brother never
Did urge me in his act. I did inquire it,
And have my learning from some true reports
That drew their swords with you. Did he not rather
Discredit my authority with yours,
And make the wars alike against my stomach,
Having alike your cause? Of this my letters
Before did satisfy you. If you’ll patch a quarrel,
As matter whole you have to make it with,
It must not be with this.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: You praise yourself
By laying defects of judgment to me; but
You patch’d up your excuses.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Not so, not so:
I know you could not lack, I am certain on’t,
Very necessity of this thought, that I,
Your partner in the cause ’gainst which he fought,
Could not with graceful eyes attend those wars
Which fronted mine own peace. As for my wife,
I would you had her spirit in such another;
The third o’ th’ world is yours, which with a snaffle
You may pace easy, but not such a wife.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Would we had all such wives, that the men might go to wars with the women!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: So much uncurbable, her garboils, Caesar,
Made out of her impatience—which not wanted
Shrowdness of policy too—I grieving grant
Did you too much disquiet. For that you must
But say I could not help it.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: I wrote to you,
When rioting in Alexandria you
Did pocket up my letters; and with taunts
Did gibe my missive out of audience.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Sir,
He fell upon me, ere admitted, then;
Three kings I had newly feasted, and did want
Of what I was i’ th’ morning; but next day
I told him of myself, which was as much
As to have ask’d him pardon. Let this fellow
Be nothing of our strife; if we contend,
Out of our question wipe him.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: You have broken
The article of your oath, which you shall never
Have tongue to charge me with.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Soft, Caesar!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: No, Lepidus, let him speak.
The honor is sacred which he talks on now,
Supposing that I lack’d it. But on, Caesar,
The article of my oath.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: To lend me arms and aid when I requir’d them,
The which you both denied.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Neglected, rather;
And then when poisoned hours had bound me up
From mine own knowledge. As nearly as I may,
I’ll play the penitent to you; but mine honesty
Shall not make poor my greatness, nor my power
Work without it. Truth is, that Fulvia,
To have me out of Egypt, made wars here;
For which myself, the ignorant motive, do
So far ask pardon as befits mine honor
To stoop in such a case.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: ’Tis noble spoken.

speech.speaker: MAEC.
speech.line: If it might please you, to enforce no further
The griefs between ye: to forget them quite
Were to remember that the present need
Speaks to atone you.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Worthily spoken, Maecenas.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Or, if you borrow one another’s love for the instant, you may, when you hear no more words of Pompey, return it again. You shall have time to wrangle in when you have nothing else to do.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Thou art a soldier only, speak no more.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: That truth should be silent I had almost forgot.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: You wrong this presence, therefore speak no more.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Go to then—your considerate stone.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: I do not much dislike the matter, but
The manner of his speech; for’t cannot be
We shall remain in friendship, our conditions
So diff’ring in their acts. Yet if I knew
What hoop should hold us staunch from edge to edge
A’ th’ world, I would pursue it.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Give me leave, Caesar—

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Speak, Agrippa.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Thou hast a sister by the mother’s side,
Admir’d Octavia. Great Mark Antony
Is now a widower.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Say not so, Agrippa;
If Cleopatra heard you, your reproof
Were well deserv’d of rashness.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I am not married, Caesar;
Let me hear Agrippa further speak.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: To hold you in perpetual amity,
To make you brothers, and to knit your hearts
With an unslipping knot, take Antony
Octavia to his wife; whose beauty claims
No worse a husband than the best of men;
Whose virtue and whose general graces speak
That which none else can utter. By this marriage,
All little jealousies, which now seem great,
And all great fears, which now import their dangers,
Would then be nothing. Truths would be tales,
Where now half tales be truths. Her love to both
Would each to other and all loves to both
Draw after her. Pardon what I have spoke,
For ’tis a studied, not a present thought,
By duty ruminated.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Will Caesar speak?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Not till he hears how Antony is touch’d
With what is spoke already.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: What power is in Agrippa,
If I would say, “Agrippa, be it so,”
To make this good?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: The power of Caesar, and
His power unto Octavia.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: May I never
(To this good purpose, that so fairly shows)
Dream of impediment! Let me have thy hand
Further this act of grace; and from this hour
The heart of brothers govern in our loves,
And sway our great designs!

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: There’s my hand.
A sister I bequeath you, whom no brother
Did ever love so dearly. Let her live
To join our kingdoms and our hearts, and never
Fly off our loves again!

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Happily, amen!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I did not think to draw my sword ’gainst Pompey,
For he hath laid strange courtesies and great
Of late upon me. I must thank him only,
Lest my remembrance suffer ill report;
At heel of that, defy him.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Time calls upon ’s.
Of us must Pompey presently be sought,
Or else he seeks out us.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Where lies he?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: About the Mount Misena.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: What is his strength by land?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Great, and increasing; but by sea
He is an absolute master.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: So is the fame.
Would we had spoke together! Haste we for it,
Yet ere we put ourselves in arms, dispatch we
The business we have talk’d of.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: With most gladness,
And do invite you to my sister’s view,
Whither straight I’ll lead you.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Let us, Lepidus,
Not lack your company.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Noble Antony,
Not sickness should detain me.

stagedir.dir: Flourish. Exeunt omnes. Manent Enobarbus, Agrippa, Maecenas.

scene.scenelocation: Rome. Octavius Caesar’s house.

stagedir.dir: Enter Antony, Caesar, Octavia between them.

scene.line: He shall to Parthia. Be it art or hap,
He hath spoken true. The very dice obey him,
And in our sports my better cunning faints
Under his chance. If we draw lots, he speeds;
His cocks do win the battle still of mine,
When it is all to nought; and his quails ever
Beat mine, inhoop’d, at odds. I will to Egypt;
And though I make this marriage for my peace,
I’ th’ East my pleasure lies.

scene.scenelocation: Rome. A street.
Alexandria. Cleopatra’s palace.

stagedir.dir: Enter Cleopatra, Charmian, Iras, and Alexas.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Give me some music; music, moody food
Of us that trade in love.

speech.speaker: CHAR., IRAS, ALEX.
speech.line: The music, ho!

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Let it alone, let’s to billards. Come, Charmian.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: My arm is sore, best play with Mardian.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: As well a woman with an eunuch play’d
As with a woman. Come, you’ll play with me, sir?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: As well as I can, madam.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: And when good will is show’d, though’t come too short,
The actor may plead pardon. I’ll none now.
Give me mine angle, we’ll to th’ river; there,
My music playing far off, I will betray
Tawny-finn’d fishes; my bended hook shall pierce
Their slimy jaws; and as I draw them up,
I’ll think them every one an Antony,
And say, “Ah, ha! Y’ are caught.”

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: ’Twas merry when
You wager’d on your angling; when your diver
Did hang a salt-fish on his hook, which he
With fervency drew up.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: That time? O times!
I laugh’d him out of patience; and that night
I laugh’d him into patience; and next morn,
Ere the ninth hour, I drunk him to his bed;
Then put my tires and mantles on him, whilst
I wore his sword Philippan.

speech.speaker: EGYPT. MESS.
speech.line: Good madam, patience.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: What say you?
Hence,
Horrible villain, or I’ll spurn thine eyes
Like balls before me; I’ll unhair thy head,

stagedir.dir: She hales him up and down.

speech.line: Thou shalt be whipt with wire, and stew’d in brine,
Smarting in ling’ring pickle.

speech.speaker: EGYPT. MESS.
speech.line: Gracious madam,
I that do bring the news made not the match.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Say ’tis not so, a province I will give thee,
And make thy fortunes proud; the blow thou hadst
Shall make thy peace for moving me to rage,
And I will boot thee with what gift beside
Thy modesty can beg.

speech.speaker: EGYPT. MESS.
speech.line: He’s married, madam.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Rogue, thou hast liv’d too long.

speech.speaker: EGYPT. MESS.
speech.line: Nay then I’ll run.
What mean you, madam? I have made no fault.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Good madam, keep yourself within yourself,
The man is innocent.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Some innocents scape not the thunderbolt.
Melt Egypt into Nile! And kindly creatures
Turn all to serpents! Call the slave again,
Though I am mad, I will not bite him. Call!

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: He is afeard to come.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: I will not hurt him.
These hands do lack nobility that they strike
A meaner than myself, since I myself
Have given myself the cause. Come hither, sir.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Good your Highness, patience.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: In praising Antony I have disprais’d Caesar.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Many times, madam.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: I am paid for’t now.
Lead me from hence;
I faint, O Iras, Charmian! ’Tis no matter.
Go to the fellow, good Alexas, bid him
Report the feature of Octavia, her years,
Her inclination; let him not leave out
The color of her hair. Bring me word quickly.
Bid you Alexas
Bring me word how tall she is. Pity me, Charmian,
But do not speak to me. Lead me to my chamber.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Your hostages I have, so have you mine;
And we shall talk before we fight.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Most meet
That first we come to words, and therefore have we
Our written purposes before us sent,
Which if thou hast considered, let us know
If ’twill tie up thy discontented sword,
And carry back to Sicily much tall youth
That else must perish here.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: To you all three,
The senators alone of this great world,
Chief factors for the gods: I do not know
Wherefore my father should revengers want,
Having a son and friends, since Julius Caesar,
Who at Philippi the good Brutus ghosted,
There saw you laboring for him. What was’t
That mov’d pale Cassius to conspire? And what
Made all-honor’d, honest, Roman Brutus,
With the arm’d rest, courtiers of beauteous freedom,
To drench the Capitol, but that they would
Have one man but a man? And that is it
Hath made me rig my navy, at whose burden
The anger’d ocean foams, with which I meant
To scourge th’ ingratitude that despiteful Rome
Cast on my noble father.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Take your time.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Thou canst not fear us, Pompey, with thy sails;
We’ll speak with thee at sea. At land, thou know’st
How much we do o’er-count thee.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: At land indeed
Thou dost o’er-count me of my father’s house;
But since the cuckoo builds not for himself,
Remain in’t as thou mayst.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Be pleas’d to tell us
(For this is from the present) how you take
The offers we have sent you.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: There’s the point.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Which do not be entreated to, but weigh
What it is worth embrac’d.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: And what may follow,
To try a larger fortune.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: You have made me offer
Of Sicily, Sardinia; and I must
Rid all the sea of pirates; then, to send
Measures of wheat to Rome. This ’greed upon,
To part with unhack’d edges and bear back
Our targes undinted.

speech.speaker: CAES., ANT., LEP.
speech.line: That’s our offer.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Know then
I came before you here a man prepar’d
To take this offer; but Mark Antony
Put me to some impatience. Though I lose
The praise of it by telling, you must know,
When Caesar and your brother were at blows,
Your mother came to Sicily and did find
Her welcome friendly.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I have heard it, Pompey,
And am well studied for a liberal thanks,
Which I do owe you.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Let me have your hand.
I did not think, sir, to have met you here.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: The beds i’ th’ East are soft, and thanks to you,
That call’d me timelier than my purpose hither;
For I have gain’d by’t.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Since I saw you last,
There’s a change upon you.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Well, I know not
What counts harsh Fortune casts upon my face,
But in my bosom shall she never come,
To make my heart her vassal.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Well met here.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I hope so, Lepidus. Thus we are agreed.
I crave our composition may be written
And seal’d between us.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: That’s the next to do.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: We’ll feast each other ere we part, and let’s
Draw lots who shall begin.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: That will I, Pompey.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: No, Antony, take the lot; but first
Or last, your fine Egyptian cookery
Shall have the fame. I have heard that Julius Caesar
Grew fat with feasting there.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: You have heard much.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I have fair meanings, sir.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: And fair words to them.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Then so much have I heard;
And I have heard, Apollodorus carried—

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: No more of that; he did so.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: What, I pray you?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: A certain queen to Caesar in a mattress.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I know thee now: how far’st thou, soldier?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Well,
And well am like to do, for I perceive
Four feasts are toward.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Let me shake thy hand,
I never hated thee. I have seen thee fight,
When I have envied thy behavior.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Sir,
I never lov’d you much, but I ha’ prais’d ye
When you have well deserv’d ten times as much
As I have said you did.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Enjoy thy plainness,
It nothing ill becomes thee.
Aboard my galley I invite you all.
Will you lead, lords?

speech.speaker: CAES., ANT., LEP.
speech.line: Show ’s the way, sir.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Come.
Thy father, Pompey, would ne’er have made this treaty.—You and I have known, sir.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: At sea, I think.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: We have, sir.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: You have done well by water.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: And you by land.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I will praise any man that will praise me, though it cannot be denied what I have done by land.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Nor what I have done by water.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Yes, something you can deny for your own safety: you have been a great thief by sea.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: And you by land.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: There I deny my land service. But give me your hand, Menas; if our eyes had authority, here they might take two thieves kissing.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: All men’s faces are true, whatsome’er their hands are.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: But there is never a fair woman has a true face.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: No slander, they steal hearts.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: We came hither to fight with you.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: For my part, I am sorry it is turn’d to a drinking. Pompey doth this day laugh away his fortune.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: If he do, sure he cannot weep’t back again.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Y’ have said, sir. We look’d not for Mark Antony here. Pray you, is he married to Cleopatra?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Caesar’s sister is call’d Octavia.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: True, sir, she was the wife of Caius Marcellus.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: But she is now the wife of Marcus Antonius.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Pray ye, sir?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: ’Tis true.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Then is Caesar and he forever knit together.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: If I were bound to divine of this unity, I would not prophesy so.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: I think the policy of that purpose made more in the marriage than the love of the parties.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I think so too. But you shall find the band that seems to tie their friendship together will be the very strangler of their amity. Octavia is of a holy, cold, and still conversation.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Who would not have his wife so?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Not he that himself is not so; which is Mark Antony. He will to his Egyptian dish again. Then shall the sighs of Octavia blow the fire up in Caesar, and (as I said before) that which is the strength of their amity shall prove the immediate author of their variance. Antony will use his affection where it is; he married but his occasion here.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: And thus it may be. Come, sir, will you aboard? I have a health for you.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I shall take it, sir; we have us’d our throats in Egypt.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Come, let’s away.

stagedir.dir: Enter two or three Servants with a banquet.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Pompey, a word.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Say in mine ear, what is’t.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Forsake thy seat, I do beseech thee, captain,
And hear me speak a word.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Forbear me till anon.—
This wine for Lepidus!

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: What manner o’ thing is your crocodile?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: It is shap’d, sir, like itself, and it is as broad as it hath breadth. It is just so high as it is, and moves with it own organs. It lives by that which nourisheth it, and the elements once out of it, it transmigrates.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: What color is it of?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Of it own color too.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: ’Tis a strange serpent.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: ’Tis so, and the tears of it are wet.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Will this description satisfy him?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: With the health that Pompey gives him, else he is a very epicure.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Go hang, sir, hang! Tell me of that? Away!
Do as I bid you.—Where’s this cup I call’d for?

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: If for the sake of merit thou wilt hear me,
Rise from thy stool.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I think th’ art mad. The matter?

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: I have ever held my cap off to thy fortunes.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Thou hast serv’d me with much faith; what’s else to say?—
Be jolly, lords.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: These quicksands, Lepidus,
Keep off them, for you sink.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Wilt thou be lord of all the world?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: What say’st thou?

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Wilt thou be lord of the whole world? That’s twice.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: How should that be?

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: But entertain it,
And though thou think me poor, I am the man
Will give thee all the world.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Hast thou drunk well?

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: No, Pompey, I have kept me from the cup.
Thou art, if thou dar’st be, the earthly Jove.
What e’er the ocean pales, or sky inclips,
Is thine, if thou wilt ha’t.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Show me which way.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: These three world-sharers, these competitors,
Are in thy vessel. Let me cut the cable,
And when we are put off, fall to their throats:
All there is thine.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Ah, this thou shouldst have done,
And not have spoke on’t! In me ’tis villainy,
In thee’t had been good service. Thou must know,
’Tis not my profit that does lead mine honor;
Mine honor, it. Repent that e’er thy tongue
Hath so betray’d thine act. Being done unknown,
I should have found it afterwards well done,
But must condemn it now. Desist, and drink.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: For this,
I’ll never follow thy pall’d fortunes more.
Who seeks, and will not take when once ’tis offer’d,
Shall never find it more.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: This health to Lepidus!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Bear him ashore. I’ll pledge it for him, Pompey.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Here’s to thee, Menas!

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Enobarbus, welcome!

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Fill till the cup be hid.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: There’s a strong fellow, Menas.

stagedir.dir: Pointing to the Attendant who carries off Lepidus.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Why?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: ’A bears the third part of the world, man; seest not?

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: The third part then is drunk. Would it were all,
That it might go on wheels!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Drink thou; increase the reels.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Come.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: This is not yet an Alexandrian feast.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: It ripens towards it. Strike the vessels ho!
Here’s to Caesar!

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: I could well forbear’t.
It’s monstrous labor when I wash my brain
And it grow fouler.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Be a child o’ th’ time.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Possess it, I’ll make answer.
But I had rather fast from all, four days,
Than drink so much in one.

speech.speaker: ENO.

stagedir.dir: Enobarbus places them hand in hand.

speech.line: Come, thou monarch of the vine,
Plumpy Bacchus with pink eyne!
In thy fats our cares be drown’d,
With thy grapes our hairs be crown’d!
Cup us till the world go round,
Cup us till the world go round!

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: What would you more? Pompey, good night. Good brother,
Let me request you off, our graver business
Frowns at this levity. Gentle lords, let’s part,
You see we have burnt our cheeks. Strong Enobarb
Is weaker than the wine, and mine own tongue
Spleets what it speaks; the wild disguise hath almost
Antick’d us all. What needs more words? Good night.
Good Antony, your hand.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I’ll try you on the shore.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: And shall, sir, give ’s your hand.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: O Antony,
You have my father’s house—But what, we are friends?
Come down into the boat.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Take heed you fall not.

stagedir.dir: Exeunt all but Enobarbus and Menas.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Hoo, says ’a. There’s my cap.

speech.speaker: MENAS.
speech.line: Ho, noble captain, come.

speech.speaker: VEN.
speech.line: Now, darting Parthia, art thou strook, and now
Pleas’d Fortune does of Marcus Crassus’ death
Make me revenger. Bear the King’s son’s body
Before our army. Thy Pacorus, Orodes,
Pays this for Marcus Crassus.

speech.speaker: SIL.
speech.line: Noble Ventidius,
Whilst yet with Parthian blood thy sword is warm,
The fugitive Parthians follow. Spur through Media,
Mesopotamia, and the shelters whither
The routed fly; so thy grand captain, Antony,
Shall set thee on triumphant chariots, and
Put garlands on thy head.

speech.speaker: VEN.
speech.line: O Silius, Silius,
I have done enough; a lower place, note well,
May make too great an act. For learn this, Silius:
Better to leave undone, than by our deed
Acquire too high a fame when him we serve’s away.
Caesar and Antony have ever won
More in their officer than person. Sossius,
One of my place in Syria, his lieutenant,
For quick accumulation of renown,
Which he achiev’d by th’ minute, lost his favor.
Who does i’ th’ wars more than his captain can
Becomes his captain’s captain; and ambition
(The soldier’s virtue) rather makes choice of loss
Than gain which darkens him.
I could do more to do Antonius good,
But ’twould offend him; and in his offense
Should my performance perish.

speech.speaker: SIL.
speech.line: Thou hast, Ventidius, that
Without the which a soldier and his sword
Grants scarce distinction. Thou wilt write to Antony?

speech.speaker: VEN.
speech.line: I’ll humbly signify what in his name,
That magical word of war, we have effected;
How with his banners, and his well-paid ranks,
The ne’er-yet-beaten horse of Parthia
We have jaded out o’ th’ field.

speech.speaker: SIL.
speech.line: Where is he now?

speech.speaker: VEN.
speech.line: He purposeth to Athens, whither, with what haste
The weight we must convey with ’s will permit,
We shall appear before him. On, there, pass along!

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: What, are the brothers parted?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: They have dispatch’d with Pompey, he is gone;
The other three are sealing. Octavia weeps
To part from Rome; Caesar is sad, and Lepidus,
Since Pompey’s feast, as Menas says, is troubled
With the green-sickness.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: ’Tis a noble Lepidus.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: A very fine one. O, how he loves Caesar!

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Nay, but how dearly he adores Mark Antony!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Caesar? Why, he’s the Jupiter of men.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: What’s Antony? The god of Jupiter.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Spake you of Caesar? How, the nonpareil!

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: O Antony! O thou Arabian bird!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Would you praise Caesar, say “Caesar,” go no further.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Indeed he plied them both with excellent praises.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: But he loves Caesar best, yet he loves Antony.
Hoo, hearts, tongues, figures, scribes, bards, poets, cannot
Think, speak, cast, write, sing, number, hoo!
His love to Antony. But as for Caesar,
Kneel down, kneel down, and wonder.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Both he loves.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: They are his shards, and he their beetle, so.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: No further, sir.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: You take from me a great part of myself;
Use me well in’t. Sister, prove such a wife
As my thoughts make thee, and as my farthest band
Shall pass on thy approof. Most noble Antony,
Let not the piece of virtue which is set
Betwixt us, as the cement of our love
To keep it builded, be the ram to batter
The fortress of it; for better might we
Have lov’d without this mean, if on both parts
This be not cherish’d.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Make me not offended
In your distrust.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: I have said.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: You shall not find,
Though you be therein curious, the least cause
For what you seem to fear. So the gods keep you,
And make the hearts of Romans serve your ends!
We will here part.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Farewell, my dearest sister, fare thee well,
The elements be kind to thee, and make
Thy spirits all of comfort! Fare thee well.

speech.speaker: OCT.
speech.line: My noble brother!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: The April’s in her eyes, it is love’s spring,
And these the showers to bring it on. Be cheerful.

speech.speaker: OCT.
speech.line: Sir, look well to my husband’s house; and—

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: What,
Octavia?

speech.speaker: OCT.
speech.line: I’ll tell you in your ear.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Her tongue will not obey her heart, nor can
Her heart inform her tongue—the swan’s down feather,
That stands upon the swell at the full of tide,
And neither way inclines.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Will Caesar weep?

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: He has a cloud in ’s face.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: He were the worse for that were he a horse;
So is he being a man.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Why, Enobarbus?
When Antony found Julius Caesar dead,
He cried almost to roaring; and he wept
When at Philippi he found Brutus slain.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: That year indeed he was troubled with a rheum;
What willingly he did confound he wail’d,
Believe’t—till I weep too.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: No, sweet Octavia,
You shall hear from me still; the time shall not
Outgo my thinking on you.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Come, sir, come,
I’ll wrastle with you in my strength of love.
Look, here I have you, thus I let you go,
And give you to the gods.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Adieu, be happy.

speech.speaker: LEP.
speech.line: Let all the number of the stars give light
To thy fair way.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Farewell, farewell.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Farewell.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Where is the fellow?

speech.speaker: ALEX.
speech.line: Half afeard to come.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Go to, go to. Come hither, sir.

stagedir.dir: Enter the Egyptian Messenger as before.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: A proper man.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Indeed he is so; I repent me much
That so I harried him. Why, methinks, by him,
This creature’s no such thing.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Nothing, madam.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Hath he seen majesty? Isis else defend!
And serving you so long!

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: I have one thing more to ask him yet, good Charmian—
But ’tis no matter, thou shalt bring him to me
Where I will write. All may be well enough.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: I warrant you, madam.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Nay, nay, Octavia, not only that—
That were excusable, that, and thousands more
Of semblable import—but he hath wag’d
New wars ’gainst Pompey; made his will, and read it
To public ear;
Spoke scantly of me; when perforce he could not
But pay me terms of honor, cold and sickly
He vented them, most narrow measure lent me;
When the best hint was given him, he not took’t,
Or did it from his teeth.

speech.speaker: OCT.
speech.line: O my good lord,
Believe not all, or if you must believe,
Stomach not all. A more unhappy lady,
If this division chance, ne’er stood between,
Praying for both parts.
The good gods will mock me presently,
When I shall pray, “O, bless my lord and husband!”
Undo that prayer, by crying out as loud,
“O, bless my brother!” Husband win, win brother,
Prays, and destroys the prayer, no midway
’Twixt these extremes at all.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Gentle Octavia,
Let your best love draw to that point which seeks
Best to preserve it. If I lose mine honor,
I lose myself; better I were not yours
Than yours so branchless. But as you requested,
Yourself shall go between ’s. The mean time, lady,
I’ll raise the preparation of a war
Shall stain your brother. Make your soonest haste;
So your desires are yours.

speech.speaker: OCT.
speech.line: Thanks to my lord.
The Jove of power make me most weak, most weak,
Your reconciler! Wars ’twixt you twain would be
As if the world should cleave, and that slain men
Should solder up the rift.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: When it appears to you where this begins,
Turn your displeasure that way, for our faults
Can never be so equal that your love
Can equally move with them. Provide your going,
Choose your own company, and command what cost
Your heart has mind to.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: How now, friend Eros?

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: There’s strange news come, sir.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: What, man?

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: Caesar and Lepidus have made wars upon Pompey.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: This is old, what is the success?

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: Caesar, having made use of him in the wars ’gainst Pompey, presently denied him rivality, would not let him partake in the glory of the action, and not resting here, accuses him of letters he had formerly wrote to Pompey; upon his own appeal, seizes him. So the poor third is up, till death enlarge his confine.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Then, world, thou hast a pair of chaps—no more,
And throw between them all the food thou hast,
They’ll grind th’ one the other. Where’s Antony?

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: He’s walking in the garden—thus, and spurns
The rush that lies before him; cries, “Fool Lepidus!”
And threats the throat of that his officer
That murd’red Pompey.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Our great navy’s rigg’d.

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: For Italy and Caesar. More, Domitius,
My lord desires you presently; my news
I might have told hereafter.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: ’Twill be naught,
But let it be. Bring me to Antony.

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: Come, sir.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Contemning Rome, he has done all this and more
In Alexandria. Here’s the manner of’t:
I’ th’ market-place, on a tribunal silver’d,
Cleopatra and himself in chairs of gold
Were publicly enthron’d. At the feet sat
Caesarion, whom they call my father’s son,
And all the unlawful issue that their lust
Since then hath made between them. Unto her
He gave the stablishment of Egypt, made her
Of lower Syria, Cyprus, Lydia,
Absolute queen.

speech.speaker: MAEC.
speech.line: This in the public eye?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: I’ th’ common show-place, where they exercise.
His sons he there proclaim’d the kings of kings:
Great Media, Parthia, and Armenia
He gave to Alexander; to Ptolomy he assign’d
Syria, Cilicia, and Phoenicia. She
In th’ abiliments of the goddess Isis
That day appear’d; and oft before gave audience,
As ’tis reported, so.

speech.speaker: MAEC.
speech.line: Let Rome be thus
Inform’d.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Who, queasy with his insolence
Already, will their good thoughts call from him.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: The people knows it, and have now receiv’d
His accusations.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Who does he accuse?

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Caesar, and that having in Sicily
Sextus Pompeius spoil’d, we had not rated him
His part o’ th’ isle. Then does he say he lent me
Some shipping unrestor’d. Lastly, he frets
That Lepidus of the triumpherate
Should be depos’d; and being, that we detain
All his revenue.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Sir, this should be answer’d.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: ’Tis done already, and the messenger gone.
I have told him Lepidus was grown too cruel,
That he his high authority abus’d,
And did deserve his change. For what I have conquer’d,
I grant him part; but then, in his Armenia
And other of his conquer’d kingdoms, I
Demand the like.

speech.speaker: MAEC.
speech.line: He’ll never yield to that.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Nor must not then be yielded to in this.

scene.scenelocation: Near Actium. Mark Antony’s camp.
scene.line: Well, I could reply:
If we should serve with horse and mares together,
The horse were merely lost; the mares would bear
A soldier and his horse.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: What is’t you say?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Your presence needs must puzzle Antony,
Take from his heart, take from his brain, from ’s time,
What should not then be spar’d. He is already
Traduc’d for levity, and ’tis said in Rome
That Photinus an eunuch and your maids
Manage this war.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Sink Rome, and their tongues rot
That speak against us! A charge we bear i’ th’ war,
And as the president of my kingdom will
Appear there for a man. Speak not against it,
I will not stay behind.

scene.line: Thy business?

speech.speaker: 2. ROM. MESS.
speech.line: The news is true, my lord: he is descried;
Caesar has taken Toryne.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Can he be there in person? ’Tis impossible
Strange that his power should be. Canidius,
Our nineteen legions thou shalt hold by land,
And our twelve thousand horse. We’ll to our ship,
Away, my Thetis!

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: By Hercules, I think I am i’ th’ right.

speech.speaker: CAN.
speech.line: Soldier, thou art; but his whole action grows
Not in the power on’t. So our leader’s led,
And we are women’s men.

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: You keep by land
The legions and the horse whole, do you not?

speech.speaker: CAN.
speech.line: Marcus Octavius, Marcus Justeius,
Publicola, and Caelius are for sea;
But we keep whole by land. This speed of Caesar’s
Carries beyond belief.

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: While he was yet in Rome,
His power went out in such distractions as
Beguil’d all spies.

speech.speaker: CAN.
speech.line: Who’s his lieutenant, hear you?

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: They say, one Taurus.

speech.speaker: CAN.
speech.line: Well I know the man.

scene.scenelocation: A plain near Actium.

stagedir.dir: Enter Caesar with his army and Taurus, marching.

scene.scenelocation: Another part of the plain near Actium.
Another part of the plain near Actium.

stagedir.dir: Canidius marcheth with his land army one way over the stage, and Taurus, the lieutenant of Caesar, the other way. After their going in, is heard the noise of a sea-fight.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Naught, naught, all naught! I can behold no longer.
Th’ Antoniad, the Egyptian admiral,
With all their sixty, fly and turn the rudder.
To see’t mine eyes are blasted.

speech.speaker: CAN.
speech.line: Our fortune on the sea is out of breath,
And sinks most lamentably. Had our general
Been what he knew himself, it had gone well.
O, he has given example for our flight,
Most grossly, by his own!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Ay, are you thereabouts?
Why then good night indeed.

speech.speaker: CAN.
speech.line: Toward Peloponnesus are they fled.

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: ’Tis easy to’t, and there I will attend
What further comes.

speech.speaker: CAN.
speech.line: To Caesar will I render
My legions and my horse: six kings already
Show me the way of yielding.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I’ll yet follow
The wounded chance of Antony, though my reason
Sits in the wind against me.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Hark, the land bids me tread no more upon’t,
It is asham’d to bear me. Friends, come hither:
I am so lated in the world, that I
Have lost my way forever. I have a ship
Laden with gold, take that, divide it; fly,
And make your peace with Caesar.

speech.speaker: ALL. ANT. ATT.
speech.line: Fly? Not we.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: I have fled myself, and have instructed cowards
To run and show their shoulders. Friends, be gone,
I have myself resolv’d upon a course
Which has no need of you. Be gone.
My treasure’s in the harbor; take it. O,
I follow’d that I blush to look upon.
My very hairs do mutiny; for the white
Reprove the brown for rashness, and they them
For fear and doting. Friends, be gone, you shall
Have letters from me to some friends that will
Sweep your way for you. Pray you look not sad,
Nor make replies of loathness; take the hint
Which my despair proclaims: let that be left
Which leaves itself. To the sea-side straightway;
I will possess you of that ship and treasure.
Leave me, I pray, a little; pray you now,
Nay, do so; for indeed I have lost command,
Therefore I pray you. I’ll see you by and by.

stagedir.dir: Enter Cleopatra led by Charmian and Eros, Iras following.

scene.scenelocation: Egypt. Octavius Caesar’s camp.

stagedir.dir: Enter Caesar, Agrippa, Thidias, and Dolabella, with others.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Approach and speak.

speech.speaker: AMB.
speech.line: Such as I am, I come from Antony.
I was of late as petty to his ends
As is the morn-dew on the myrtle leaf
To his grand sea.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Be’t so, declare thine office.

speech.speaker: AMB.
speech.line: Lord of his fortunes he salutes thee, and
Requires to live in Egypt, which not granted,
He lessons his requests, and to thee sues
To let him breathe between the heavens and earth,
A private man in Athens: this for him.
Next, Cleopatra does confess thy greatness,
Submits her to thy might, and of thee craves
The circle of the Ptolomies for her heirs,
Now hazarded to thy grace.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: For Antony,
I have no ears to his request. The Queen
Of audience nor desire shall fail, so she
From Egypt drive her all-disgraced friend,
Or take his life there. This if she perform,
She shall not sue unheard. So to them both.

speech.speaker: AMB.
speech.line: Fortune pursue thee!

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Bring him through the bands.
To try thy eloquence, now ’tis time; dispatch.
From Antony win Cleopatra, promise,
And in our name, what she requires; add more,
From thine invention, offers. Women are not
In their best fortunes strong, but want will perjure
The ne’er-touch’d vestal. Try thy cunning, Thidias,
Make thine own edict for thy pains, which we
Will answer as a law.

speech.speaker: THID.
speech.line: Caesar, I go.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Observe how Antony becomes his flaw,
And what thou think’st his very action speaks
In every power that moves.

speech.speaker: THID.
speech.line: Caesar, I shall.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: What shall we do, Enobarbus?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Think, and die.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Is Antony or we in fault for this?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Antony only, that would make his will
Lord of his reason. What though you fled
From that great face of war, whose several ranges
Frighted each other? Why should he follow?
The itch of his affection should not then
Have nick’d his captainship, at such a point,
When half to half the world oppos’d, he being
The mered question. ’Twas a shame no less
Than was his loss, to course your flying flags,
And leave his navy gazing.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Prithee peace.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Yes, like enough! High-battled Caesar will
Unstate his happiness, and be stag’d to th’ show
Against a sworder! I see men’s judgments are
A parcel of their fortunes, and things outward
Do draw the inward quality after them,
To suffer all alike. That he should dream,
Knowing all measures, the full Caesar will
Answer his emptiness! Caesar, thou hast subdu’d
His judgment too.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Mine honesty and I begin to square.
The loyalty well held to fools does make
Our faith mere folly; yet he that can endure
To follow with allegiance a fall’n lord
Does conquer him that did his master conquer,
And earns a place i’ th’ story.

scene.line: To be sure of that,
I will ask Antony. Sir, sir, thou art so leaky
That we must leave thee to thy sinking, for
Thy dearest quit thee.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Favors? By Jove that thunders!
What art thou, fellow?

speech.speaker: THID.
speech.line: One that but performs
The bidding of the fullest man, and worthiest
To have command obey’d.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: You will be whipt.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Approach there!—Ah, you kite!—Now gods and devils!
Authority melts from me. Of late, when I cried “Ho!”
Like boys unto a muss, kings would start forth
And cry, “Your will?”—Have you no ears?—I am
Antony yet.

stagedir.dir: Enter First Egyptian Servant, others following.

speech.line: ’Tis better playing with a lion’s whelp
Than with an old one dying.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Moon and stars!
Whip him. Were’t twenty of the greatest tributaries
That do acknowledge Caesar, should I find them
So saucy with the hand of she here—what’s her name,
Since she was Cleopatra? Whip him, fellows,
Till like a boy you see him cringe his face,
And whine aloud for mercy. Take him hence.

speech.speaker: THID.
speech.line: Mark Antony—

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Tug him away. Being whipt,
Bring him again; the Jack of Caesar’s shall
Bear us an arrant to him.
Is he whipt?

speech.speaker: 1. EGYPT. SERV.
speech.line: Soundly, my lord.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Cried he? And begg’d ’a pardon?

speech.speaker: 1. EGYPT. SERV.
speech.line: He did ask favor.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: If that thy father live, let him repent
Thou wast not made his daughter, and be thou sorry
To follow Caesar in his triumph, since
Thou hast been whipt for following him. Henceforth
The white hand of a lady fever thee,
Shake thou to look on’t. Get thee back to Caesar,
Tell him thy entertainment. Look thou say
He makes me angry with him; for he seems
Proud and disdainful, harping on what I am,
Not what he knew I was. He makes me angry,
And at this time most easy ’tis to do’t:
When my good stars, that were my former guides,
Have empty left their orbs, and shot their fires
Into th’ abysm of hell. If he mislike
My speech and what is done, tell him he has
Hipparchus, my enfranched bondman, whom
He may at pleasure whip, or hang, or torture,
As he shall like, to quit me. Urge it thou:
Hence with thy stripes, be gone!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: Now he’ll outstare the lightning: to be furious
Is to be frighted out of fear, and in that mood
The dove will peck the estridge; and I see still
A diminution in our captain’s brain
Restores his heart. When valor preys on reason,
It eats the sword it fights with. I will seek
Some way to leave him.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: He calls me boy, and chides as he had power
To beat me out of Egypt. My messenger
He hath whipt with rods, dares me to personal combat,
Caesar to Antony. Let the old ruffian know
I have many other ways to die; mean time
Laugh at his challenge.

speech.speaker: MAEC.
speech.line: Caesar must think,
When one so great begins to rage, he’s hunted
Even to falling. Give him no breath, but now
Make boot of his distraction: never anger
Made good guard for itself.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Let our best heads
Know that tomorrow the last of many battles
We mean to fight. Within our files there are,
Of those that serv’d Mark Antony but late,
Enough to fetch him in. See it done,
And feast the army; we have store to do’t,
And they have earn’d the waste. Poor Antony!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: He will not fight with me, Domitius?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: No.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Why should he not?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: He thinks, being twenty times of better fortune,
He is twenty men to one.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Tomorrow, soldier,
By sea and land I’ll fight; or I will live,
Or bathe my dying honor in the blood
Shall make it live again. Woo’t thou fight well?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I’ll strike, and cry, “Take all!”

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Well said, come on.
Call forth my household servants, let’s tonight
Be bounteous at our meal.
What means this?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: ’Tis one of those odd tricks which sorrow shoots
Out of the mind.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: And thou art honest too.
I wish I could be made so many men,
And all of you clapp’d up together in
An Antony, that I might do you service
So good as you have done.

speech.speaker: ALL. ANT. ATT.
speech.line: The gods forbid!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Well, my good fellows, wait on me tonight.
Scant not my cups, and make as much of me
As when mine empire was your fellow too,
And suffer’d my command.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: What does he mean?

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: To make his followers weep.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Tend me tonight;
May be it is the period of your duty;
Haply you shall not see me more, or if,
A mangled shadow. Perchance tomorrow
You’ll serve another master. I look on you
As one that takes his leave. Mine honest friends,
I turn you not away, but like a master
Married to your good service, stay till death.
Tend me tonight two hours, I ask no more,
And the gods yield you for’t!

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: What mean you, sir,
To give them this discomfort? Look, they weep,
And I, an ass, am onion-ey’d. For shame,
Transform us not to women.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Ho, ho, ho!
Now the witch take me, if I meant it thus!
Grace grow where those drops fall, my hearty friends!
You take me in too dolorous a sense,
For I spake to you for your comfort, did desire you
To burn this night with torches. Know, my hearts,
I hope well of tomorrow, and will lead you
Where rather I’ll expect victorious life
Than death and honor. Let’s to supper, come,
And drown consideration.

speech.speaker: ANT. 1. SOLD.
speech.line: Brother, good night; tomorrow is the day.

speech.speaker: ANT. 2. SOLD.
speech.line: It will determine one way; fare you well.
Heard you of nothing strange about the streets?

speech.speaker: ANT. 1. SOLD.
speech.line: Nothing. What news?

speech.speaker: ANT. 2. SOLD.
speech.line: Belike ’tis but a rumor. Good night to you.

speech.speaker: ANT. 1. SOLD.
speech.line: Well, sir, good night.

speech.speaker: ANT. 2. SOLD.
speech.line: Soldiers, have careful watch.

speech.speaker: ANT. 3. SOLD.
speech.line: And you. Good night, good night.

stagedir.dir: They place themselves in every corner of the stage.

speech.speaker: ANT. 2. SOLD.
speech.line: Here we. And if tomorrow
Our navy thrive, I have an absolute hope
Our landmen will stand up.

speech.speaker: ANT. 1. SOLD.
speech.line: ’Tis a brave army,
And full of purpose.

stagedir.dir: Music of the hoboys is under the stage.

scene.scenelocation: Alexandria. Before Cleopatra’s palace.

stagedir.dir: Enter Antony and Cleopatra, Charmian, with others.

scene.line: Come, good fellow, put thine iron on.
If Fortune be not ours today, it is
Because we brave her. Come.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Nay, I’ll help too.
What’s this for?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Ah, let be, let be! Thou art
The armorer of my heart. False, false; this, this.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Sooth law, I’ll help. Thus it must be.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Well, well,
We shall thrive now. Seest thou, my good fellow?
Go, put on thy defenses.

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: Briefly, sir.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Is not this buckled well?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Rarely, rarely:
He that unbuckles this, till we do please
To daff’t for our repose, shall hear a storm.
Thou fumblest, Eros, and my queen’s a squire
More tight at this than thou; dispatch. O love,
That thou couldst see my wars today, and knew’st
The royal occupation, thou shouldst see
A workman in’t.

stagedir.dir: Enter Captain of Antony’s Army, Captains and Soldiers.

speech.speaker: CHAR.
speech.line: Please you retire to your chamber?

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Lead me.
He goes forth gallantly. That he and Caesar might
Determine this great war in single fight!
Then, Antony—but now—Well, on.

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: The gods make this a happy day to Antony!

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Would thou and those thy scars had once prevail’d
To make me fight at land!

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: Hadst thou done so,
The kings that have revolted, and the soldier
That has this morning left thee, would have still
Followed thy heels.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Who’s gone this morning?

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: Who?
One ever near thee. Call for Enobarbus,
He shall not hear thee, or from Caesar’s camp
Say “I am none of thine.”

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: What sayest thou?

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: Sir,
He is with Caesar.

speech.speaker: EROS.
speech.line: Sir, his chests and treasure
He has not with him.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Is he gone?

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: Most certain.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Go, Eros, send his treasure after; do it,
Detain no jot, I charge thee. Write to him
(I will subscribe) gentle adieus and greetings;
Say that I wish he never find more cause
To change a master. O, my fortunes have
Corrupted honest men! Dispatch. Enobarbus!

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Go forth, Agrippa, and begin the fight.
Our will is Antony be took alive;
Make it so known.

speech.speaker: AGR.
speech.line: Caesar, I shall.

speech.speaker: 3. CAES. MESS.
speech.line: Antony
Is come into the field.

speech.speaker: CAES.
speech.line: Go charge Agrippa
Plant those that have revolted in the vant,
That Antony may seem to spend his fury
Upon himself.

speech.speaker: CAES. 1. SOLD.
speech.line: Enobarbus, Antony
Hath after thee sent all thy treasure, with
His bounty overplus. The messenger
Came on my guard, and at thy tent is now
Unloading of his mules.

speech.speaker: ENO.
speech.line: I give it you.

speech.speaker: CAES. 1. SOLD.
speech.line: Mock not, Enobarbus,
I tell you true. Best you saf’d the bringer
Out of the host; I must attend mine office,
Or would have done’t myself. Your emperor
Continues still a Jove.

scene.scenelocation: Field of battle between the camps.

stagedir.dir: Alarum. Drums and Trumpets. Enter Agrippa and others.
Alarums. Enter Antony, and Scarus wounded.

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: They do retire.

speech.speaker: SCAR.
speech.line: We’ll beat ’em into bench-holes. I have yet
Room for six scotches more.

scene.scenelocation: Under the walls of Alexandria.

stagedir.dir: Alarum. Enter Antony again, in a march, Scarus, with others.

scene.line: O thou day o’ th’ world,
Chain mine arm’d neck, leap thou, attire and all,
Through proof of harness to my heart, and there
Ride on the pants triumphing!

speech.speaker: CLEO.
speech.line: Lord of lords!
O infinite virtue, com’st thou smiling from
The world’s great snare uncaught?

speech.speaker: ANT.
speech.line: Mine nightingale,
We have beat them to their beds. What, girl, though grey
Do something mingle with our younger brown, yet ha’ we
A brain that nourishes our nerves, and can
Get goal for goal of youth. Behold this man,
Commend unto his lips thy favoring hand.
Kiss it, my warrior; he hath fought today
As if a god, in hate of mankind, had
Destroyed in such a shape.

speech.speaker: CLEO.
